content:
BitmapImage Class

Definition

Provides a specialized BitmapSource that is optimized for loading images using Extensible Application Markup Language (XAML).

In this Article

public sealed class BitmapImage : System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource, System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize, System.Windows.Markup.IUriContext

Animatable

Examples

The following code examples demonstrate how to use a BitmapImage in Extensible Application Markup Language (XAML) and code. 

<!-- Property Tag XAML Syntax -->
<Image Width="200"  Margin="5" Grid.Column="1" Grid.Row="1" >
   <Image.Source>
      <BitmapImage UriSource="sampleImages/bananas.jpg" />
   </Image.Source>
</Image>

<!-- Property Tag XAML Syntax -->
<Image Width="200"  Margin="5" Grid.Column="1" Grid.Row="1" >
   <Image.Source>
      <BitmapImage UriSource="sampleImages/bananas.jpg" />
   </Image.Source>
</Image>

// Create the image element.
Image simpleImage = new Image();    
simpleImage.Width = 200;
simpleImage.Margin = new Thickness(5);

// Create source.
BitmapImage bi = new BitmapImage();
// BitmapImage.UriSource must be in a BeginInit/EndInit block.
bi.BeginInit();
bi.UriSource = new Uri(@"/sampleImages/cherries_larger.jpg",UriKind.RelativeOrAbsolute);
bi.EndInit();
// Set the image source.
simpleImage.Source = bi;

' Create the image element.
Dim simpleImage As New Image()
simpleImage.Width = 200
simpleImage.Margin = New Thickness(5)

' Create source.
Dim bi As New BitmapImage()
' BitmapImage.UriSource must be in a BeginInit/EndInit block.
bi.BeginInit()
bi.UriSource = New Uri("/sampleImages/cherries_larger.jpg", UriKind.RelativeOrAbsolute)
bi.EndInit()
' Set the image source.
simpleImage.Source = bi

Remarks

BitmapImage primarily exists to support Extensible Application Markup Language (XAML) syntax and introduces additional properties for bitmap loading that are not defined by BitmapSource.

BitmapImage implements the ISupportInitialize interface to optimize initialization on multiple properties. Property changes can only occur during object initialization. Call BeginInit to signal that initialization has begun and EndInit to signal that initialization has completed. After initialization, property changes are ignored.

BitmapImage objects created using the BitmapImage constructor are automatically initialized and property changes are ignored.

Constructors

BitmapImage()

Initializes a new instance of the BitmapImage class.

public BitmapImage ();

Remarks

BitmapImage implements the ISupportInitialize interface to optimize initialization on multiple properties. To initialize a BitmapImage created using this constructor, you must perform property initialization between BeginInit and EndInit calls.

BitmapImage(Uri)

Initializes a new instance of the BitmapImage class by using the supplied Uri.

public BitmapImage (Uri uriSource);
uriSource
Uri

The Uri to use as the source of the BitmapImage.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

The uriSource parameter is null.

FileNotFoundException

The file specified by the uriSource parameter is not found.

Remarks

BitmapImage objects created using this constructor are automatically initialized. After initialization, property changes are ignored.

BitmapImage(Uri,RequestCachePolicy)

Initializes a new instance of the BitmapImage class with an image whose source is a Uri, and is cached according to the provided RequestCachePolicy.

public BitmapImage (Uri uriSource, System.Net.Cache.RequestCachePolicy uriCachePolicy);
uriSource
Uri

The Uri to use as the source of the BitmapImage.

uriCachePolicy
RequestCachePolicy

The RequestCachePolicy that specifies the caching requirements for images that are obtained using HTTP.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

The uriSource parameter is null.

FileNotFoundException

The file specified by the uriSource parameter is not found.

Remarks

BitmapImage objects created using this constructor are automatically initialized. After initialization, property changes are ignored.

BitmapImage is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see Versions and Dependencies.

Identifies the stem.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.CacheOption* dependency property.

Identifies the stem.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.UriCachePolicy* dependency property.

public static readonly System.Windows.DependencyProperty UriCachePolicyProperty;

Remarks

UriCachePolicyProperty is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see Versions and Dependencies.

UriSourceProperty

Identifies the stem.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.UriSource* dependency property.

public static readonly System.Windows.DependencyProperty UriSourceProperty;

Properties

BaseUri

Gets or sets a value that represents the base Uri of the current BitmapImage context.

public Uri BaseUri { get; set; }
Value
Uri

The base Uri of the current context.

CacheOption

Gets or sets the BitmapCacheOption to use for this instance of BitmapImage.

public System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption CacheOption { get; set; }
Value
BitmapCacheOption

The BitmapCacheOption being used for the BitmapImage. The default is BitmapCacheOption.

Remarks

Set the CacheOption to System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption if you wish to close a stream used to create the BitmapImage. The default BitmapCacheOption cache option retains access to the stream until the image is needed, and cleanup is handled by the garbage collector.

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field CacheOptionProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

CreateOptions

Gets or sets the BitmapCreateOptions for a BitmapImage.

public System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCreateOptions CreateOptions { get; set; }
Value
BitmapCreateOptions

The BitmapCreateOptions used for this BitmapImage. The default is BitmapCreateOptions.

Remarks

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field CreateOptionsProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

DecodePixelHeight

Gets or sets the height, in pixels, that the image is decoded to.

public int DecodePixelHeight { get; set; }
Value
Int32

The height, in pixels, that the image is decoded to. The default value is 0.

Remarks

If DecodePixelWidth is also set, the aspect ratio of the bitmap is ignored. If DecodePixelWidth is not set, the aspect ratio remains the same.

The JPEG and Portable Network Graphics (PNG) codecs natively decode the image to the specified size; other codecs decode the image at its original size and scale the image to the desired size.

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field DecodePixelHeightProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

DecodePixelWidth

Gets or sets the width, in pixels, that the image is decoded to.

public int DecodePixelWidth { get; set; }
Value
Int32

The width, in pixels, that the image is decoded to. The default value is 0.

Remarks

IfDecodePixelHeight is also set, the aspect ratio of the bitmap is ignored. If DecodePixelHeight is not set, the aspect ratio remains the same.

The JPEG and Portable Network Graphics (PNG) codecs natively decode the image to the specified size; other codecs decode the image at its original size and scale the image to the desired size.

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field DecodePixelWidthProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

IsDownloading

Gets a value that indicates whether the BitmapImage is currently downloading content.

public override bool IsDownloading { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the BitmapImage is downloading content; otherwise, false.

Metadata

Not supported. BitmapImage does not support the Metadata property and will throw a NotSupportedException.

public override System.Windows.Media.ImageMetadata Metadata { get; }
Value
ImageMetadata

Not supported.

Exceptions
NotSupportedException

An attempt to read the Metadata occurs.

Rotation

Gets or sets the angle that this BitmapImage is rotated to.

public System.Windows.Media.Imaging.Rotation Rotation { get; set; }
Value
Rotation

The rotation that is used for the BitmapImage. The default is Rotation.

Remarks

Rotation is performed after scaling. This means that an image that has a Rotation of Rotation, a DecodePixelWidth of 10, and DecodePixelHeight of 5 will result in an image that has a width of 5 and a height of 10.

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field RotationProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

SourceRect

Gets or sets the rectangle that is used as the source of the BitmapImage.

public System.Windows.Int32Rect SourceRect { get; set; }
Value
Int32Rect

The rectangle that is used as the source of the BitmapImage. The default is stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Empty*.

Remarks

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field SourceRectProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

StreamSource

Gets or sets the stream source of the BitmapImage.

public System.IO.Stream StreamSource { get; set; }
Value
Stream

The stream source of the BitmapImage. The default is null.

Remarks

If StreamSource and UriSource are both set, the StreamSource value is ignored.

Set the CacheOption property to System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption if you wish to close the stream after the BitmapImage is created. The default BitmapCacheOption cache option retains access to the stream until the bitmap is needed, and cleanup is handled by the garbage collector.

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field StreamSourceProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

UriCachePolicy

Gets or sets a value that represents the caching policy for images that come from an HTTP source.

public System.Net.Cache.RequestCachePolicy UriCachePolicy { get; set; }
Value
RequestCachePolicy

The base RequestCachePolicy of the current context. The default is null.

Remarks

UriCachePolicy is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see Versions and Dependencies.

UriSource

Gets or sets the Uri source of the BitmapImage.

public Uri UriSource { get; set; }
Value
Uri

The Uri source of the BitmapImage. The default is null.

Remarks

If StreamSource and UriSource are both set, the StreamSource value is ignored.

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field UriSourceProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

Methods

BeginInit()

Signals the start of the BitmapImage initialization.

public void BeginInit ();
Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

The BitmapImage is currently being initialized. BeginInit has already been called.

-or-

The BitmapImage has already been initialized.

Remarks

Property initialization must be done between BeginInit and EndInit calls. Once the BitmapImage has been initialized, property changes are ignored.

Clone()

Creates a modifiable clone of this BitmapImage, making deep copies of this object's values.

public System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage Clone ();
Returns
BitmapImage

A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property is false even if the source's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property is true.

Remarks

This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen Freezable objects (or any Freezable object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version.

For more information, see Clone.

When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.

CloneCore(Freezable) 

protected override void CloneCore (System.Windows.Freezable source);
source
Freezable

To be added.

CloneCurrentValue()

Creates a modifiable clone of this BitmapImage object, making deep copies of this object's current values. Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.

public System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage CloneCurrentValue ();
Returns
BitmapImage

A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property is false even if the source's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property is true.

Remarks

This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen Freezable objects (or any Freezable object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version.

For more information, see CloneCurrentValue.

CloneCurrentValueCore(Freezable) 

protected override void CloneCurrentValueCore (System.Windows.Freezable source);
source
Freezable

To be added.

protected override System.Windows.Freezable CreateInstanceCore ();
Returns
Freezable

To be added.

Signals the end of the BitmapImage initialization.

public void EndInit ();
Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

The stem.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.UriSource* or stem.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.StreamSource* properties are null.

-or-

The EndInit method is called without first calling stem.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.BeginInit*.

Remarks

Property initialization must be done between BeginInit and EndInit calls. Once the BitmapImage has been initialized, property changes are ignored.
